p: Diagnoses of COVID-19 were carried out according to national guidelines [ 6]. Severe cases were defined as dyspnoea, respiratory frequency ≥30/min, blood oxygen saturation ≤93%, partial pressure of arterial oxygen to fraction of inspired oxygen ratio <300 mmHg, and/or lung infiltrates >50% within 24–48 h. Critical cases were defined as having respiratory failure, septic shock, and/or multiple organ dysfunction or failure. Clinical outcomes, including continued hospitalization, discharge and death, were recorded as of February 29, 2020.
